instructions: Preheat the oven to 475°F (245°C). Roll out the pizza dough on a baking sheet. Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough. Tear fresh mozzarella cheese and place it on the sauce. Scatter basil leaves over the cheese. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and black pepper. Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly. Slice and serve hot.

Marinate chicken thighs in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices for at least 2 hours. Grill the marinated chicken until cooked through. In a separate pan, melt butter and sauté tomato puree until it thickens. Add heavy cream and simmer. Cut grilled chicken into bite-sized pieces and add them to the sauce. Cook until the sauce is thick and chicken is heated through. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves and serve hot with rice or naan.

Slice tomatoes and fresh mozzarella cheese into thick slices. Arrange them alternately on a serving platter. Tuck fresh basil leaves between the tomato and cheese slices. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Season with salt and black pepper. Let it marinate for a few minutes before serving.

Soak rice noodles in warm water until soft. Heat oil in a wok or large skillet. Add minced garlic and chopped tofu. Cook until tofu is golden brown. Push tofu to one side and crack eggs into the wok. Scramble until set. Add shrimp and stir-fry until pink. Add soaked rice noodles, bean sprouts, chopped peanuts, and sauce mixture. Stir-fry until noodles are cooked through. Serve hot with lime wedges.

Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). In a food processor, combine parsley, dill, chives, lemon zest, garlic, olive oil, salt, and black pepper. Pulse until finely chopped. Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Spread the herb mixture evenly over the salmon. Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork. Serve hot.

Brown ground beef in a skillet over medium heat. Drain excess fat and add taco seasoning. Cook until beef is fully coated and heated through. Warm taco shells in the oven according to package instructions. Fill each taco shell with seasoned beef, lettuce, tomatoes, shredded cheese, and desired toppings. Serve with salsa, sour cream, avocado slices, and lime wedges.

Season chicken breasts with salt, black pepper, and olive oil. Grill or pan-sear until cooked through. Let the chicken rest for a few minutes before slicing. In a large bowl, toss torn romaine lettuce with Caesar dressing until evenly coated. Add croutons and shaved Parmesan cheese. Top with sliced grilled chicken. Squeeze lemon juice over the salad before serving.

Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Cook lasagna noodles according to package instructions. Meanwhile, thinly slice zucchini, yellow squash, and bell peppers. Sauté spinach with minced garlic in olive oil until wilted. In a bowl, mix ricotta cheese, egg, grated Parmesan cheese, salt, and black pepper. Spread a thin layer of marinara sauce in a baking dish. Layer cooked lasagna noodles, sautéed vegetables, ricotta mixture, and shredded mozzarella cheese. Repeat layers until all ingredients are used up, ending with a layer of marinara sauce and mozzarella cheese on top. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove foil and bake for an additional 15 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown. Let it rest for 10 minutes before slicing.

Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Season ground beef with salt and black pepper. Shape into patties of desired size. Grill burgers for 4-5 minutes per side or until cooked to your liking. Toast hamburger buns on the grill until lightly browned. Assemble burgers with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, pickles, and condiments. Serve hot.

Heat vegetable oil in a large pot or Dutch oven. Add cumin seeds and cook until fragrant. Add finely chopped onion, garlic, and ginger. Sauté until onion is translucent. Stir in diced tomatoes and cook until softened. Add diced potatoes, carrots, green beans, and cauliflower florets. Stir in curry powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook until vegetables are tender. Stir in peas and cook for a few more minutes. Serve hot with rice or naan.

Cook pasta according to package instructions. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant. Add diced tomatoes and cook until softened. Toss cooked pasta with the tomato mixture. Tear fresh mozzarella cheese and basil leaves, and add them to the pasta. Season with salt and black pepper. Serve hot.

ingredients: Vegetables (Bell peppers, Eggplant, Bamboo shoots, etc.)
instructions: In a wok or large skillet, heat coconut milk over medium heat until it begins to simmer. Add green curry paste and stir until fragrant. Add vegetables of your choice and tofu. Stir in fish sauce and palm sugar. Simmer until vegetables are tender. Add Thai basil leaves and torn kaffir lime leaves. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Preheat the oven to 475°F (245°C). Roll out the pizza dough on a baking sheet. Spread BBQ sauce evenly over the dough. Top with grilled chicken, pineapple chunks, sliced red onion, and diced bell peppers. Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese over the toppings. Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

In a large saucepan, heat olive oil and butter over medium heat. Add finely chopped onion and minced garlic. Cook until softened. Add sliced mushrooms and cook until they release their moisture. Stir in Arborio rice and cook until translucent. Pour in dry white wine and stir until absorbed. Add vegetable broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring constantly until absorbed. Continue adding broth and stirring until rice is creamy and tender. Stir in grated Parmesan cheese and season with salt and black pepper. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Cook chicken breasts until fully cooked. Shred the chicken using two forks. In a large bowl, mix shredded chicken with black beans, corn, diced onion, diced bell peppers, and a portion of enchilada sauce. Spread a spoonful of enchilada sauce on the bottom of a baking dish. Fill each flour tortilla with the chicken mixture, roll it up, and place it seam-side down in the baking dish. Pour the remaining enchilada sauce over the rolled tortillas. Sprinkle shredded cheese on top. Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot with sour cream, sliced avocado, and lime wedges.
